alert.note: Alert for Amelia; Chesterfield; Powhatan (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 13 at 9:16AM EST until January 15 at 11:54AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Virginia... Appomattox River At Mattoax affecting Amelia, Powhatan and Chesterfield Counties. For the Appomattox Basin...including Farmville, Mattoax, Matoaca... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Appomattox River at Mattoax. * WHEN...Until late Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Agricultural and some secondary roads flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM EST Saturday the stage was 24.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 19.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 AM EST Saturday was 24.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 25.1 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 25.1 feet on 05/20/2014. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening.this evening at 930 PM EST.
